summary: This is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Alexander Acosta and defense attorney Roy Black regarding a discussion about the performance of Jeffrey Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement. The exchange shows coordination between the prosecution and defense regarding the implementation of the controversial plea deal.

persons.name: A. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The prosecutor who initiated the email chain to discuss the Epstein matter, specifically regarding the performance of the criminal Non-Prosecution Agreement. He provides his office address in West Palm Beach, FL.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: The defense attorney being contacted by Acosta to discuss the Epstein case. He indicates he is traveling in California but available to call.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email discussion regarding his criminal Non-Prosecution Agreement.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating about the implementation of Jeffrey Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement.
Roy Black is identified as Epstein's defense attorney in this correspondence.
Acosta as the prosecutor overseeing Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Discussion of Epstein NPA Performance
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Acosta contacts defense attorney Roy Black to discuss the performance of Jeffrey Epstein's criminal Non-Prosecution Agreement.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Alexander Acosta directly communicated with Epstein's defense attorney Roy Black about the Non-Prosecution Agreement.
The communication occurred on July 30, 2008, regarding the 'performance' of Epstein's plea deal.
Roy Black was traveling in California when contacted about the Epstein matter.
The email chain shows coordination between prosecution and defense regarding implementation of the controversial agreement.
